bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 150 (Tuesday, August 24, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. HERRERA BEUTLER:H.R. 5093.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2[Page H4489]

item.name: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

item.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H7399)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5093.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H7399-7400)
Mr. Lowenthal moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 338.
Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 117-434.
Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 117-434.
Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Discharged.

National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

item.title: H.R. 5093, Wind River Administrative Site Conveyance Act

summary.text:
Wind River Administrative Site Conveyance Act

This bill directs the Forest Service to convey to Skamania County in Washington, upon request of the county, all right, title, and interest of the United States in approximately 23.4 acres of National Forest System land, related infrastructure, and all improvements on the map titled Wind River Administrative Site Conveyance Proposal and dated July 7, 2020.

The conveyance shall be

  • made by quitclaim deed;
  • subject to a right-of-way and restrictive easement reservation for the protection of the Pacific Crest National Scenic Trail; and
  • completed in accordance with certain Forest Service conveyance requirements, except that certain market value requirements shall not apply.

The Forest Service must meet specified disclosure requirements for hazardous substances, pollutants, and contaminants and shall not otherwise be required to remediate or abate the hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants disclosed.

The lands and related infrastructure conveyed must be maintained by the county pursuant to standards established by the Department of the Interior regarding the preservation of historic property.

Wind River Administrative Site Conveyance Act

This bill directs the Forest Service to convey to Skamania County in Washington, upon request of the county, all right, title, and interest of the United States in approximately 23.4 acres of National Forest System land, related infrastructure, and all improvements on the map titled Wind River Administrative Site Conveyance Proposal and dated July 7, 2020.

The conveyance shall be

  • made by quitclaim deed;
  • subject to a right-of-way and restrictive easement reservation for the protection of the Pacific Crest National Scenic Trail; and
  • completed in accordance with certain Forest Service conveyance requirements, except that certain market value requirements shall not apply.

The Forest Service must meet specified disclosure requirements for hazardous substances, pollutants, and contaminants and shall not otherwise be required to remediate or abate the hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants disclosed.

The lands and related infrastructure conveyed must be maintained by the county pursuant to standards established by the Department of the Interior regarding the preservation of historic property.

  • completed in accordance with certain Forest Service conveyance requirements, except that certain market value requirements shall not apply.

The Forest Service must meet specified disclosure requirements for hazardous substances, pollutants, and contaminants and shall not otherwise be required to remediate or abate the hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants disclosed.

The lands and related infrastructure conveyed must be maintained by the county pursuant to standards established by the Department of the Interior regarding the preservation of historic property.

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: Wind River Administrative Site Conveyance Act
To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to transfer certain National Forest System land in the State of Washington to Skamania County, Washington.

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
